nodes.bodyText: Add a UT for this
should the token also go into the t_entities table?

I was thinking a similar thing but right now we seem to separate that logic and make it explicit by adding an account.
It really should be called entity

Doing it this way also avoids having a combined object that contains token and entity info.
I think it's cleaner this way and avoids confusion.
for consistency and readability, suggest a token's id is defined by both entity_realm and entity_num like the accounts.
Can update this. It should be as you've noted
Should this also use parsePublicKey?

Eventually it should.
Right now accounts/balances endpoint need some refactoring as they don't utilize the improved logic we brought in when adding the topic messages endpoint.
Comment not moved
Updated
description does not match the scenario
Will update
wrong description
Had renamed the file, will update
this test case shouldn't pass, account 0.0.2 does not exist

nodes.bodyText:
The query confers with the token_account table, which would only contain an account reference if an account existed when a token was associated with.
If there was no reference of account 0.0.2 in token _account this result would return back en empty list
In the REST call we probably don't need to add the overhead of also checking the entities table for the account given the above fact.
I can add account 0.0.2 to the entities table for consistency though.

nodes.bodyText: Should we add types to these so it's clear they're tokens and not accounts? In the future, we should rename "accounts" array to "entities".
Yes added locally pushing up in next commit
Was gonna do the accounts -> entities change but Xin's PR does that so I'll leave as is

Q: should we use account.publickey instead of entity.publickey? The balances REST API uses account.publickey btw.
Also, the design doc has an optional filter by token admin publickey, initially I thought entity.publickey is the admin key filter.

nodes.bodyText:
So the reason I added entity.public key is so that we don't have to add a new one for every entity.
Right now we have account.pubickey, in this case the entity is a token not an account.
If similar logic was used on files, contract, topics or any future entity type we'd want the naming to be appropriate.
I didn't want to refactor account and balance as part of this change because it would break the API.

nodes.bodyText: I think being explicit about what type of entity the public key is for is better. part of my confusion of entity.publickey   = account.publickey also came from other test cases and I'll leave separate comments.

nodes.bodyText: I'm not a fan of entity.publickey. It's generic while this public key is specifically associated with the token entity. Why not just publickey like in the design? Since we're in the tokens context it should be sufficient.

nodes.bodyText:
I had entity because I wanted all entities that ended up having publickey filters to use it instead of the specific account.publickey which obviously calls out accounts only.
I used the entity prefix to try to be consistent with that.
I'm also not a fan of the x.y filter names so I'm okay with making it just publickey

nodes.bodyText: Can just set a default when declaring limit.
Updated

accounts shouldn't be reused for the purpose of adding tokens into t_entities table. in addition, entries in the accounts array are inserted with fk_entity_type_id = 1, while for tokens, it should be 5
I updated the token entities with the type 5 just now
